name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Georgia research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Georgia ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Georgia ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine priorities for Georgia research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Georgia research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Georgia Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for Georgia ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Georgia Research, 1880-Present

  3. Get an overview of Georgia research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Georgia Overview—6:50

  4. Introduction: Learn about basic Georgia research strategies.

    ☆ AR—Family History Research in Georgia

  5. Ancestry: Explore resources for Georgia research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Georgia Resources
    ☆ AC—Georgia State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  6. Record Finder: Use the Georgia Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Georgia Record Finder

    7. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about research in colonial Georgia.

      ☆ AC—Colonial Georgia

    5. Follow this case study for Georgia research.

      ☆ LDS—Finding the family of a man from South Carolina living in Georgia


    Ethnic
    1. African American: Study the this Georgia resource page on FamilySearch.

      ☆ FS—African American Resources for Georgia
    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—Georgia African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Georgia.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Georgia in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Georgia

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Georgia archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Georgia archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Georgia archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Georgia Archives and Libraries

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Georgia.

  5. Explore the Digital Library of Georgia site .

  7. Search for ☆free online books on Georgia research on the FamilySearch site.
  8. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Georgia ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

text:
1. Search for ☆Georgia historical newspapers in the Library of Congress collection.
  2. Find links to Georgia newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Search the Georgia Online Historical Newspapers site.
  4. Explore Georgia newspaper resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  5. Explore the Georgia Historic Newspapers site, part of the Digital Public Library of America.
  6. See additional Georgia newspaper resources on the Linkpendium site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Georgia research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Georgia County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Georgia.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Georgia Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Georgia research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Georgia Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Georgia Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Georgia Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. Visit the Georgia Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  6. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Georgia.
Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Georgia research.
  2. Explore the Georgia research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Georgia research.
  4. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for help with Georgia research.
  5. Explore Georgia research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.
